ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing, reading, speaking and listening Chinese.
I developed stronger writing skills in Chinese, specifically more formal writing.
A good understanding of the vocab and grammar regarding relevant topics of discussion in modern society like abortion and taiwan china relations.
I developed my Chinese cultural knowledge, as well as my Chinese speaking, reading, and writing ability, both typed and handwritten.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I absolutely love the Chinese classes at Yale. The syllabus is obviously very carefully developed and everything works so smoothly.

Weaknesses: It's very condensed so youll be constantly grinding vocab and getting the homeworks and quizzes and tutorials done. Strengths: the tutorials were good for developing conversational fluency though they were a bit annoying to have to go to every week. Also, The lecturers were very kind, understanding and passionate. You will get better at Chinese through brute force of having to study the language every day.
This course was incredibly fast-paced, but I learned an incredible amount and was able to greatly improve my Chinese ability.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely!! It is a lot of work but I can assure you you will learn Chinese so well!

I would definitely recommend this course, it was by far my favorite course this semester.  The seminar style is very engaging, and the course being taught strictly in Mandarin helps improve your language abilities quicker.
Yes if they want to get better at Chinese and are willing to work hard.
I would recommend this course to any student who wishes to become more confident in their Chinese ability.
